data.title: A Guide to Canadian Literary Magazines
data.meta_description: Canadian literary magazines publish much of Canada’s best poetry and prose. The writers whose creative work appears in their pages range from established icons of Canadian literary arts—such as Alice Munro, Margaret Atwood and Lynn Coady, to name just a few—to new writers published for the first time. The following list, compiled by the National…
data.text:
Canadian literary magazines publish much of Canada’s best poetry and prose. The writers whose creative work appears in their pages range from established icons of Canadian literary arts—such as Alice Munro, Margaret Atwood and Lynn Coady, to name just a few—to new writers published for the first time.

The following list, compiled by the National Media Awards Foundation, is an A-to-Z guide to Canadian literary periodicals and their submissions guidelines. This guide focuses on magazines that currently publish short fiction, poetry, and/or creative (aka literary) non-fiction. Many of these magazines also accept submissions for essays, literary criticism, reviews, interviews, graphic narratives, and visual art. Some of the works published in these magazines have even won a National Magazine Award!

If you’d like your magazine listed, please email us. There is no charge to be added and we include a wide variety of magazines, journals, and publications from across the country in our guide.

Acta Victoriana

Published in: Ontario (Victoria University, Toronto)

Founded: 1878

Genres: Fiction, poetry, visual arts

Issues per Year: 4

Submissions Guidelines

Ampersand Review of Writing and Publishing, The

Published in: Ontario (Mississauga)

Founded: 2020

Genres: Poetry, fiction, creative non-fiction, essays, interviews, and book reviews

Issues per Year: 2

Submission Guidelines

Founded: 1978
